meanings.definition: Discourteous or impolite in behavior or speech.
meanings.sent1: She was very rude to the waiter, speaking harshly and without manners.
meanings.sent2: It is rude to interrupt someone while they are speaking.
meanings.sent3: The rude parrot kept squawking loudly during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent4: The storm was rude, knocking down trees and causing chaos.
meanings.sent5: His rude behavior left a lasting impression on everyone at the party.

meanings.definition: Roughly made or done; lacking refinement or delicacy.
meanings.sent1: The rude wooden chair creaked loudly whenever someone sat on it.
meanings.sent2: The rude drawing showed little attention to detail or finesse.
meanings.sent3: The rude sandcastle collapsed as soon as the waves touched it.
meanings.sent4: The rude painting seemed to have been done in a hurry, with no care for precision.
meanings.sent5: The rude stitching on the shirt made it uncomfortable to wear.

meanings.definition: Abrupt or blunt in manner or speech.
meanings.sent1: His rude response caught her off guard, leaving her speechless.
meanings.sent2: The rude dismissal of her idea left her feeling disheartened.
meanings.sent3: The rude alarm clock jolted him awake with its loud ringing.
meanings.sent4: The rude thunder interrupted the peaceful silence of the night.
meanings.sent5: The rude awakening to the harsh reality was a shock to her system.
